Fortunately the two times that I've gone here recently it was a weekday and late morning just before the lunch rush starts - the two previous times that I tried to go was during peak hours and there was quite a wait so my companions and I opted for somewhere else.  I really like this local restaurant - the food is well prepared and fresh, the coffee is strong and delicious (just the way that I like it) and the servers are very friendly despite being busy.  On my first visit I had the Grilled shrimp & Manchego cheese grits with house salsa, apple smoked bacon topped with poached eggs.  It was hands down delicious and not at all greasy like some of the shrimp and grits that I've had at other restaurants.  My friend had the Pancetta Omelet with kale, reggiano and roasted tomatoes.  We both really enjoyed our meals and the coffee as I already stated was fantastic - it was strong, smooth, rich and low on acid - a near perfect cup of joe.    On my most recent visit, I was alone and stopped by for a late breakfast/early lunch and I was half tempted to order the shrimp and grits again, but when the waitress told me that the Seafood Etouffee that was on special that day was soon going to be taken off of the menu permanently, I decided that I had to try it.  Their Seafood Etouffee had 3 large shrimp, and 2 perfectly cooked scallops with a tomato base that was filled with crab and a bit of jasmine rice.  This was a meal!  I was hungry and this completely filled me up - I liked that there wasn't a lot of rice to overtake the dish and that it didn't dominate the delicious flavors of the seafood in the rich, flavorful tomato base.  The ONLY criticism I have is that it was actually a little too salty for my taste and I am someone who likes salt and it was a bit much, otherwise the dish was as good as any New Orleans restaurant that I've dined at during the over 20 times that I've been to N'Awlins.  Don't despair that it's no longer on the menu however because there are dozens of dishes on the menu that I'm sure are fabulous.  I'm looking forward to going back to Coca Cafe again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. So glad that I got to try the Etouffee before they took it off the menu. So delicious!

Vg1Rtl9LzdObI6CllkW2kg.text: Coca cafe has this really unique vibe. Their menu items are diverse and the quality of food  is good in general. Ive tried the Shakshouka before and it was really good. My second favorite is the eggplant Benedict. However, I wish they would handle customers better. My plate had a hair in it and I called the waitress to take care of it, and she was like "oh I see it" and removed the plate, wiped it off and returned it without changing the food or apologizing or anything. She didn't even take it off the bill. Customers service 101 when your business makes a mistake try to at least apologize or compensate the customer.

photos.caption: Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggplants Benedict with a side of hair

troLmbsIyv_DtSnVmNuDBA.text: Visited Coca Cafe this week for lunch with a friend.  The place is cozy and clean.  Ordered a Black Bean burger with salad greens.  The burger was amazing!  Best Black Bean burger I ever had.  Will definitely have it again.  The waitress was awesome!  Very attentive, and friendly.  Beautiful setting. Prices reasonable. Check it out!

cgFdNuRu-9SrR4NPD5giJA.text: This place has gone waaaaay downhill. First off it was so loud in there we couldn't have a conversation. Our waiter was hard to understand as he ran through the specials and rang up our checks wrong. The omelet we're dry and barely had any cheese in them and the potatoes had no flavor other than some sour taste that we could not identify. Omelets have shrunk in size from last year when I was there. What happened?? Also the ceiling fan doesn't look like it's been cleaned in years. Zucchini bread was good.

BlcgO7Adl8VEKFdQXqpSJg.text: Food was really great, love that there were many vegetarian options.  Problem is that they told us 45 min wait but we waited 1 hr 15 min and then took about 45 minutes for our food.  Our waitress did a good job, not her fault that the food was so slow.  Bottom line, if you are okay waiting a lot then the food is worth it!  I had a special which was the burrata benedict, the basil hollandaise was excellent!

3vkiSubgoe9vZmodjK7yvw.text: Went today on a friend's recommendation. We were told an hour wait and ended up waiting an hour & half to be seated. Server was awful. Had to ask twice for sweetener for my coffee - after such a long wait I just wanted to enjoy a cup of coffee... Gentleman that brought out our food offered to refill my cup - only offer I received. Waitress only checked back on us once - this was after we watched her take out trash and return to her tables without washing her hands. Admittedly, our food was very good. The experience was NOT worth the wait.

2QGM2l_ZHeQh5q6eUuqz-w.text: Checked out this place for brunch, and on the spectrum of great brunch places in Pittsburgh it was just eh.  I started off with coffee, nice and strong and rich, just how I like it.  Then went in for the buttermilk donut with a raspberry goat cheese icing.  It was the highlight of the meal and really went well with the richness of the coffee.  For my meal I ordered fried green tomatoes eggs benedict with the banana pepper hollandaise sauce.  Fried green tomatoes were thick, crunchy, and perfectly cooked.  However, the whole dish didn't work well together.  Instead of the traditional Canadian bacon, they used a thick cut, crisp bacon which tasted good but was impossibbbblleeee to cut through with the wimpy butter knife given to you.  It felt like you were supposed to pick up the eggs benedict to eat it, which makes for a messy brunch.  The hollandaise sauce was blander than most, and definitely had no banana pepper flavor.  The homefries were crisp and delicious.  I tasted one of my dining partner's pumpkin pancakes with maple butter and caramelized pears which was very tasty on a crisp fall day.  Service was pretty darn good for a busy breakfast place.  Overall, not bad.  If I was in the neighborhood, I'd go, but I certainly wouldn't travel far for this place.

6uYJoW_D0vesBH6WhI3-JQ.text: Menu is unique. Service can be a little slow because they are usually packed but if you have time to have a leisurely brunch, check it out!

IXenDLVEdvLcZ1kJZ5TCug.text: Given that the quality of the food and service at Coca range from Meh to Wonderful, not to mention the hour-plus waits, I think there are several superior weekend brunch options in Pittsburgh.  They could improve things by offering the option of reservations, and/or expanding their space and service staff. They always seem to have one too few wait staff, in my opinion.  One particularly lousy time at brunch my partner and I waited twenty minutes to get coffee and water, and then an hour for our food (which came out cold).  They did give us a gift card to compensate, which was a thoughtful and we appreciated.   As negative as I am being, it's in part a counterpoint the glowing praises.  On the plus side, it is a very cute place, they have more vegetarian and vegan brunch options than almost anyplace in Pittsburgh (big props for the tofu scramble option for the vegans of the world!), and when the food is on point, it's pretty great. I had the three-cheese omelette one time with a few added vegggies, and it was out-of-this world tasty.   Do yourself a favor: Opt to have breakfast at Coca on a weekday morning.  On a Sunday morning, opt instead to show up at Park Bruges or Point Brugge promptly at 10:45.

RZOGSGTY7aQvehzN_G2ExQ.text: Perfectly portioned to satisfy but not stuff.  The Coca sandwich was delicious.

9QuPojk-qWF8Sb3YQtefwg.text: Let me preface this review by saying that as a vegan, I never expect that restaurants that don't advertise vegan options will go out of their way to accommodate my dietary choices. However, Coca Cafe indicates several menu options as being able to be made vegan.   I ordered the vegan version of the Breakfast Sandwich, which is ordinarily served with over easy eggs, fresh avocado, apple smoked bacon and house kimchi on sourdough bread. To make this dish vegan required the replacement of the bread, replacement of the eggs, and removal of the meat (note: their soy sausage is vegetarian but not vegan).   What I received (after 45 minutes of waiting) was two fairly uncooked, unseasoned slabs of tofu on dry whole wheat toast with a smudge of avocado and kimchi on one side, with a side of unripe honey dew. My sandwich (and fruit) was completely devoid of flavor. I would have sent it back, but anticipated any replacement would have been similarly bland. Other local vegan-friendly restaurants will often add additional ingredients or at least some seasoning to dishes that lose a large amount of flavor due to the removal/substitution of primary ingredients, but this sandwich just felt like a lazy afterthought.  The two guests I was eating with ordered the (non-vegan version) Breakfast Sandwich and Pancetta Omelet respectively, both of which turned out to be disappointingly tasteless as well.   Again, I do not ever expect that a restaurant will really work to cater to my strict diet unless specified, but to suggest an abundance of vegan-friendly menu options and get this was just disheartening. Would not recommend to vegans and omnivores alike.

pPITt8OJgOtZhTihY5pNDQ.text: No one is ever going to convince me to stand in line for breakfast in the Strip again - not when I can sit in a sunny enclosed porch in Lawrencewille and have what must be the best omlette I have tasted stateside.  My omelette had portobello mushrooms and shallots perfectly caramelized folded in with goat cheese and spinach. The potatoes are crisp and not at all greasy. It was delicious without being heavy - which is hard to find in a Pittsburgh breakfast. Service was pleasant.    What a happy find- this is going to become a regular place for breakfast.

AJVU55yQx6nmRE6s-Nohhw.text: I make it to Pittsburgh with regularity, and I always stop here for breakfast.  Perhaps I need to take up on some of the other breakfast joints in town and broaden my impression of the city's food scene, but every meal here has been outstanding.  It pains me not to make some recommendations, but I've had nearly all the menu choices and everything has been solid.  So my suggestion is to pick what sounds best.    As for some of the other reviews, I love the atmosphere and have almost always seen the place hopping.  If the complaint is over wait times, then go to a place with a drive-through.  Otherwise, sit down and enjoy this darling little spot in Lawrenceville.  I'll not remark on the service.  But the food and the ambience are very strong aspects of Coca.

luKmFo0Hohmb9HQOy3vQcQ.text: Every time I come here, I wait an extremely, and unnecessary amount of time. We used the Nowait app, so fortunately we were sat almost immediately when arriving. However, it took almost 15 minutes for anyone to come over to us to say anything. We ordered food and coffee at the same time, and it took about 25 minutes to receive 3 coffees. After 75 minutes, we finally received our food, with no word from any one, except once. We did not get water for over an hour and a half after asking multiple times. The food was very good; however, it does not make up for waiting over an hour and a half in total. We then had to wait another 15 minutes to get a check, which we had to go up to the counter and ask for ourselves. We are usually not this picky, but it took everyone a very long time to receive their food, drinks, anything. A long piece of plastic was also found in the coffee, and was not taken off the bill until we complained. Overall, if you are very patient and have over 2 hours to give, I do not recommend coming here.

OXmRygxQX_z6CAuj_4GvFA.text: I only give 5 stars when a place is mind-blowing. I can say it in 5 words. Goat cheese stuffed French toast. Mind-blowingly good.   Know the deal, call them before you leave the house and get your name on the list. They'll take your cell # and call when your table is ready. Get there a bit before your ETA and cruise Butler St shops. Do not just show up for Sunday brunch and ask how long the wait is. You'll be bummed by the answer.   Also had their house-smoked salmon omelette. Also special.

7_Pvr7bLXCOoOYvySYdy6g.text: This place is always packed, which is a bit of a mystery to me. Had a 30 min wait for a table (on a Tuesday morning) and ordered a breakfast sandwich and an omelette. Not complicated items. Tea drinks we ordered tasted like they were made from a mix (and I think they were) and food took over an HOUR. Waitress couldn't be bothered. Sandwich was cold, everything else unimpressive. They took our drinks off the bill but it still felt like a waste of time and money. If you're looking for good brunch in Lawrenceville, go to the Vandal instead.

xCijEpK9se70-tOumHqogw.text: Over priced under served average food. Do not eat here. I feel like asking for my tip back. Do not expect a refill on coffee.

N5Q4TAcacAMQGhXwuBPXCg.text: I have tried this place several times and have not been impressed at all. The food was OK to fair and overpriced. Each time I was there the service was slow and it took a long time to get waited on and get our food. Not a place I would recommend!

__0f19cll2ddV38K0m9n2A.text: Eh. The food was okay, but the service was terrible. We were seated immediately but food took over 45 minutes to get to us. The waitress was also very short with us. If you're looking for a quick brunch, this isn't it. I probably won't come back.

QnVnoiBjacH_HqgZRXrPlw.text: Once again a bad experience.  The service was super slow and when we said something the owner/'manager got very defensive.  I find the attitude of the staff to be super pretentious.   This place could be nice but the team ruin it.

MjAxyOoT9GSFCXH95KBSwQ.text: To the people who run this place: Coca Cafe USED to be my favorite brunch place in Pittsburgh, but after eating there today, we're disappointed and don't intend to return.   - we were greeted with a frown upon entering and it felt like the staff was doing us a favor in letting us dine here, the whole time - the menus plopped on the table were dirty and wrinkly pieces of paper. - aprons / staff clothing were dirty - there were not 2 or 3... but 8 seeds in my orange juice.  - we sat in the back and it had a weird smell   Staying home and having cereal would have been a better start to the day.

tzZkOwUHNThLwsx6ZykPNQ.text: We went here because it said there was no wait on the Yelp app, but there was a considerable wait actually and they just weren't using the app for their waitlist. We waited for our table and walked around outside for awhile until we were called. Then we waited at the table for about 15 minutes and no one came by. We ended up leaving without being able to order anything.

WAjGlbpoiw_ndJP3TYa7Bw.text: I had heard so much about this place that I wanted to give it a try. I arrived shortly after 9 midweek and there was plenty of tables both front and in the back. The front decor is very trendy. The back is just your usual style with booths but air covered.  I saw a sign by the entrance indicating that they use the no wait app but for me that wasn't an issue. I was given multiple menus to look over including mimosas, drinks, and of course their breakfast menu. I was in the mood for an omelette and after asking about certain toppings which I didn't understand I learned their omelettes are made with 9 yes 9 eggs! I thought 5 was too much when I was in Chicago. I asked if they could be made with egg whites. I was told yes but for $1.50 more. Please note that their prices have increased slightly if you check out their website and they have noted outside a brand new menu.  To me it looked like much of the same stuff. I decided to steer clear of the French toast and pancakes and settled for one of the eggs Benedict. Here I learned they are made with two poached eggs that sit on top of an English muffin. I ordered the various mushroom type which come with potatoes. My coffee seemed lukewarm but the lady obliged by giving me another cup. The place has an extensive beverage selection on the chalkboard including hot chocolate. Juices are also available.  There weren't very many people inside and I was surprised how long it took to get my breakfast! Must have been a good 15-20 minutes. I chalked that one up to them having to make an omelet with 9 eggs. I would have liked to have seen that omelet but didn't. All I know from what she told me it is huge!!!  Anyway I finally got my food. The potatoes were good but seemed a bit dry. The mushroom eggs Benedict I thoroughly enjoyed. They have one gender neutral restroom in the front section.   My waitress was busy but attentive to my needs. I got the check and I'm glad I ordered what I did because this place can be pricey. The place is small so I can see very well how easily it gets crowded for brunch. This place also serves lunch but they close early usually around 3.  It is located in lower Lawrenceville not far from Expresso a mano. You can park on one of the off streets for free if you are lucky. If you want a good and hearty breakfast meal for a descent price there are plenty of other options around the city. If you have time to kill and want to spend extra money for average food then you've come to the right place.

photos.caption: Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mushroom eggs Benedict with potatoes and fruit
Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Neat  artwork
Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Inside

2FS9eUxpMi08opO8H8pJzg.text: I'm extremely disappointed with my visit today at Coca Cafe. In my past experiences' it's been a decent cafe that I have invited people to come. In fact, I celebrated my birthday here. However, today my experience was completely AWFUL! The table was dirty, there was hair in my boyfriend's food, and my food was just underwhelming to say the least. The onwer was extremely rude. She was upset that he no longer wanted the meal or for them to remake it. She didn't offer him something different or even compensate for the disgusting mistake. I will NEVER  patronize this business again. There are A lot of good options in the area. Do yourself a favor and skip this one!

0hGxgPN3mFq2YYxL-1T-rg.text: An excellent brunch spot in Lawrenceville. My friend and I came around 10:30 on a Sunday. Definitely use the NoWait app or be prepared to wait 45 minutes to an hour. We luckily used the app and arrived when our table was ready. I ordered a chai latte and the eggplant eggs benedict and my friend had the challah french toast with brie and fig jam.   As others have noted, my main issue with Coca Cafe was not the food but the service. My waiter had forgotten about my chai latte and brought it out over a half hour after I ordered. Our food came after about 45 minutes of waiting.   Luckily, the food was delicious. My eggplant eggs benedict was perfect. The eggplant was not too thick and nice and crispy. Their lemon basil hollandaise sauce was also the perfect complement. The potatoes could have used a bit more seasoning. My friend also enjoyed her french toast.   Overall, the quality of the food was fantastic. The reason for the four stars is the amount of waiting. If they could get their food out just a bit faster, maybe they would not have such long wait times. As I thoroughly enjoyed my eggs benny, I look forward to coming back on a less crowded day.

photos.caption: Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggplant Eggs Benedict with chai

huNVPS4EX2KboRslIcIkHg.text: I've been here in the past and really enjoyed it. I decided to take my family there for Sunday brunch at noon since they were visiting for the weekend. I anticipated a 30 minute wait which is normal so we walked around the block to pass time.   After the 30 minutes we were seated and ordered coffees and food. The coffee was quick but it took over an hour for the food to come out. There was another table that complained for the wait and even though the place was full, not one table had any food on the table. The manager said they were backed up washing dishes, and later when we asked the waiter said the kitchen was running behind on orders. Two different stories but finally after 75 minutes our food came out!  The omelettes were ok but the potatoes tasted raw. When we complained about the wait the manager said it was normal and decided to take out coffees off the bill. It was a small gesture but she did not seem apologetic in tone despite saying she apologizes. The meal should have been free, the food was subpar especially compared to past experiences, and the wait was awful. A pirates player also happened to stopped by but because it took so long to seat his party he did not bother to return. I was thoroughly disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Avocado omelette with undercooked potatoes

2-IZHXs0_79qBIyg9ifT7Q.text: Service is terrible. Only one person works the kitchen and the wait is very long. If I could give zero stars I would. Drinks are all lukewarm, even the iced water. Food takes forever to come out. Kind of a shame how bad the service is, considering that the food is actually pretty good, and that there's a wide selection on the menu. Ordered the donut holes, ended up being cake/brownie balls? One had a hair in it. Orange juice took 30 min to be served. Server also charged for bacon that was never brought out. Not worth it.

T70bXmRlme43n48_0RBxbw.text: Unfortunately for me I'm obsessed with the huevos grits here so I keep going back but the service is so incredibly bad I don't even know where to start. I'm a take out fan and their phone has been broken since March. Here's the solution: call an alarming number of times and they'll start to recognize your phone number and call you back from someone cell phone. It's complete absurdity. There are also three (at least) menus floating around online, none of which are apparently accurate. One time I showed up to grab my take out for a group and the woman working only told me when I arrived that their credit card machine was down. Luckily I had enough cash to pay because she didn't even know where the closest ATM was. Like I said, it's a personal problem that I keep ordering from here bc the food is good and I live next door but overall, don't waste your time. They have no respect for the customer and basically don't give a shit if you eat there or not. They're miserable.

lUUdrok2lTiSnH9oOA3pUg.text: This was a terrible dining experience. The food took forever, was layered with salt, and my husband had two hairs in his food. I would never eat here again.

ejXxbtVW8kHcVt4HEGKgoA.text: Something has happened to Coca Cafe and it isn't good.  Last year at this time we went for brunch and it was very busy with a wait time. This year the place was nearly empty. The service was extremely slow. I was in very good company so I don't mind waiting for over 20 minutes to get my drink. I ordered the tofu scramble, which I had had before, but this time it was overly salty and barely edible. My friend is on a specific diet and ordered the egg dish without the feta.  She was served the feta but they held the fruit. I suppose they do both start with "f". I'm just not sure it's worth going back again. I'm giving three stars because my drink was very good when I finally received it.

t25Ih-nQNWvUwiNdHtiRFA.text: This used  to be a very good place but has declined recently.  The past couple time have been rather disappointing.  Most recently, I arrived early on a Saturday so that I did not have to wait.  Their hours say they open at 9am.  Well, they did not open the doors until 915am.  Get it together.  While there, service was slow and our waiter did not know the menu well.     I ordered the cappuccino which was not very good.  I also had the corn flake crusted french toast.  This was lukewarm at best.  It had likely been under a not so good heat lamp for some time.  This is not a large place, they can do better.    I am not sure what is going on with this place.  Used to be one of my favorite spots, but am not going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. CornFlake Crusted French Toast served luke warm
Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Blah Capacino

mhels8yQ5SJjP4Ds_Z5bLw.text: I went to this restaurant after seeing yelp reviews. But I was totally disappointed with service and the time it took. We were in Pittsburgh for weekend and stopped by this restaurant for brunch. Food was okay, we were given one menu with limited options for course 1 and course 2. It took one hour for each course to arrive. And we ended up spending 2.5 hours in this restaurant!! Not worth it at all. And it spoiled our schedule for the entire day!

xcOLFdM8uM2h7eFBSTvxkQ.text: Came in from out of town for my parents birthday and wanted to treat them to a nice breakfast. I used to love this place but now Coca Cafe boasts poor service is understaffed and poorly managed.   Our waitress told us several times that she can take our order but that it would not be placed before the large party. Even if that was True, that's not something you share with a group who have been waiting for an hour. It certainly doesn't get people excited to eat here. Waitress was rude and heard her talking about us to other staff.  Really disappointed in the service and will not be coming back.

WvWj8KMb-jSsVRuva7U0VQ.text: Looked like a cute place from the outside and was busy!  Photos posted online were appetizing.  So we took a chance.... 2 adults and 2 toddlers.  No one acknowledged me when I walked in.  Waited several minutes just to be recognized and seated.   Service staff seemed stressed out and short staffed for the volume of tables offered.  The menu offerings were great though (including kid servings of regular items for $4), so we were excited to give it a chance. Waited more than 45 min for our food.  Kids got their food so long before we did they were done and ready to leave before we got our food.  My son asked for maple syrup, which had a strange film of mold at the surface so I didn't let him use it.  Finally our food came.  Omelette was soggy in the middle-- hubs didn't eat it.  My eggs Benedict had a soggy English muffin and, I'm not sure what happened to the egg, but the white was absent and I was served just the yolk with a straggle of white hanging off of it.    All in all, looked much better than it was.  Be prepared to spend 2 hours to eat.  My advice to the owner would be to please have the staff to serve the number of tables offered... and quality check the food

Z2aOtoEjQ2QEpgQQOOikiQ.text: I have tried to give this place a chance, but today was my last visit. The servers were not attentive about anything, when we would say "excuse me" we were ignored.   After we placed our order, we did not get our food for 45 minutes and it was delivered from the kitchen. The wait staff did not check on us and barely acknowledged us. My water glass was empty over half of the time and my friend could not drink water because there was something in her glass.   When we finally were asked about our checks (once we put our cards on the table) there was an error with our receipts. We spoke to someone about this (perhaps manager?) and she would not let us finish our sentence and kept covering up the receipt and would say "all that matters is the card numbers are right" but our names were wrong and they charged the wrong cards. They were very unhelpful and refused to listen to the costumer (even interrupted us) several times.   I have enjoyed the food, but there are so many places in Pittsburgh with similar food that also staff people who are kind and attentive. We never received an apology for anything throughout our entire 1 1/2 hour experience and we will not be visiting again.

5nbMxP73qzSQL7_19G7x1w.text: I'd give this place a solid 4/5.  The prices are too high but the food is great. The bibibamp was good however it wasn't served in the stone bowl that makes the rice crunchy. I am sure it's an issue of ordering the bowls for the restaurant and then changing the menu.   The eggs Benedict were really great.   I will be excited to come back to see some of the older menu items come back around. I feel like this particular menu didn't strike the wow factor for me. I will be back when the shrimp and grits or the pancakes come back around.

photos.caption: Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Drink list.
Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bibimbamp. Pretty good. They need to serve in in the hot stone bowl though.
Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried eggplant eggs Benedict

D-Pq9TTqLYf8okRO5FSkZA.text: We were excited to go to Coca cafe again. We realized that there were a lot of people there for brunch but we waited 45 minutes for a table, which was understandable. Once our table was ready we were seated and we ordered coffee and food right away. We waited over an hour for our food to come. We were starving at this point. Our food finally came out and it was cold. Nothing on our plate was hot. We told the waitress and the only thing said was that our meals were not sitting waiting in the back. She didn't offer to heat anything up. Long story short, we paid our bill and left starving. Do not recommend anymore, unfortunately. Very disappointed.

TNt24jwEX8CF4f92sA3I6A.text: So apparently this place is really crowded on weekends?  I went on a weekday around lunch when it was only about half full, thankfully. The decor is super cute - a bit retro. The tables are bit and spaced openly - I love that they're not cramming tables into their small space.  First of all, with their awesome sounding menu and elevated food concept, I would've expected their coffee to be excellent. It was dilute and a bit burnt and tasted as crappy as (if not a little worse than) 24-hour diner coffee. Tsk.  Second, the service was really crappy. I don't know if they were understaffed or what, but the waitress was in a rush to take our orders but rarely refilled our waters and coffees. And food took forever to come out... what's up with that?  Third, the food. It was a bit of a letdown. The pesto/sun dried tomato/salami omelet is one of my favorite combinations at my favorite brunch spot in Chicago. This version was alright... but something was missing, and the flavors just didn't seem balanced. The omelet seemed like it was supposed to be fluffy, but it wasn't that great. My friend's smoked salmon omelet was collapsed (not to mention underwhelming in smoked salmon flavor and presence). I didn't try the challah french toast - no complaints or raves from the person who ordered it though.  I'm still willing to give this place another chance. And by no means was the food bad - just not super awesome. But the reviews here and the menu itself sounded AWESOME. The actual food didn't quite live up to the expectations.   Maybe it's a fluke? Maybe since brunch food is a pretty competitive and saturated niche in Chicago, my standards are set pretty high? Maybe they are just staffed better in the front and back on the weekends? Who knows. I'll see next time.

vQrKpE8aThjE2-wL5Ti8bQ.text: Really bad coffee for one. It reminds me of gas station coffee. I came here with my sister and mom, my sisters challah French toast was thinly sliced which is of course not how to make challah French toast (it was soggy and gross). My meal came with toast and had to hunt down a server to get butter then had to wait five minutes to get butter with no apology or excuse from the server. Then I turned the toast over and noticed it was burnt to a crisp and inedible. Because our server was so hard to get a hold of, I knew if I tried to get new toast my omelette would be cold by the time I would get it. I added avocado to my omelette and it was literally brown--very old. Why do they think it's ok to serve that?? Very meh, bad service and chefs that think it's ok to serve inedible food.

photos.caption: Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

NoONasAmN-TeSMvDOYYSdw.text: Waited 55 minutes to be seated and 1 hour to get our food.  When asked how long our food would be we were told that a 45-60 wait for food is expected.  It would have been very nice if this was expressed from the beginning.  We ordered 2 cheese omelettes that were not cheesy at all!! After an hour wait for food our plates still came out with no potatoes on them and my bf was missing his fruit. I'm ok waiting for food if it's good but it was not.  We will never be back and never ever refer this place to anyone.

Q9J6B3GkjCKLg1yQy_sDEw.text: Meh...   I had higher hopes for this venue, as I've heard good things about it.   I love that the menu is diverse, but the food was just okay.    I had the avocado omelette with a side of potatoes. These were good,  but not spectacular. My friend had the pumpkin pancakes, which weren't amazing according to her.  My other friend had their special for the day, which was grits with hard-boiled eggs enclosed in something... (not sure, see pic).   I'd give Coca another chance,  but this visit didn't meet my expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kale juice
Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Avocado omelette with salmon inside
Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grits with something...

Hy1VWLiN4DP187Q6dPLhZw.text: The manager was EXTREMELY rude when I called to ask for a reservation. I was directed to "NO WAIT" app, but the app said there was not a line and didn't allow me to add my name to the list. I explained this to manager , who yelled at me saying ...we don't take reservations. I went in person, was told it would be about  20 minute wait. I checked back 2 times, and 10-15 minutes were added to expected wait . So we were finally seated after 45 minutes. Took another 20 for food to come. It was hot, and good, but I won't be returning. Too many good alternatives in the area that DO APPRECIATE my business

lHCts-wIY7rzww0PHFzduA.text: This was an impulsive breakfast choice for us since the place we were originally going to was packed. The menu is absolutely awesome! So many specialty things to choose from and they all sounded so good.   I had the sun dried tomato pesto omelette with sausage and pepperoni. Yes it was just as amazing as it sounds. The egg was fluffy and had a perfect amount of all the ingredients. I was wary of the pepperoni in my omelette at first but it really complimented the other flavors for a tasty combination.   My boyfriend had the herbed goat cheese stuffed French toast. First of all I'd like to say that I am a fan of French toast stuffed with pretty much anything. It was awesome. It didn't even need syrup with the creaminess of the cheese and powdered sugar on top. Perfect!  My only complaint was the cramped feel of the place. There was no way for me to get out of my chair once I say down. Also the water glasses were dirty. Luckily I got a cup if chai tea, which was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sun dried tomato and pesto omelette. Yum!

AS1upvRMbn_r01326u6pVg.text: This place is definitely up there on my list of top brunches.  I had the shakshuka, and my boyfriend had one of the breakfast sandwiches. We split the French toast with Brie and berries. It was all so delicious we've been trying to get back for a while. It can be a bit of a wait if you have a larger group but it's definitely worth it, when there was only two of us we waited for about 25 minutes.   Service was fine, nothing bad nothing great

vrr29ou_gjPHJEYRioWVyw.text: If it were possible to give 0 stars, I would. When told that we would have a table in 20 minutes, it took over an hour to sit. Then we went 20 minutes without someone even asking for a drink order. We had to go ask for menus ourselves. We had to wait another hour to eat.   It is ridiculous to me that they wouldn't hire more wait staff for a Sunday brunch! I will absolutely not be returning here, and I recommend you don't either.

fgsA8iAXO8kS4kQr3eq4mg.text: Creative and very well thought out menu items, however unreliable and lackluster execution. You can order the same dish on two separate occasions and be completely satiated or slightly frustrated. Also, service on the weekends is broaching unacceptable. Inordinate wait times to even receive your drinks, even when the place isn't at capacity. The table next to us inquired about their food, and we overheard the most rude response that included an incredulous, "Have you been here before? On a weekend? It's an hour to be seated and another hour to receive your food." Sorry, but please don't take your inadequacies out on your clientele.

RgRhLHmLcIsypMmJHkAWvA.text: Got so excited from all the reviews here so I obviously had to order three different entrees. Stuffed myself happy and didn't need to eat anything else for the rest of the day.  Ordered: -butternut squash risotto - the sage was amazing and complimented the sunny egg. So delish. -french toast goat cheese - tasty with the strawberries and cheese flavor wasn't too overwhelming.  -avocado omelette - standard dish done very well with hearty chunks of avocado and salsa. Yummy! -almond soda - this was interesting indeed and definitely warrants a try.  Great brunch place! Worth the 30min wait.

DlyVnBwcpHV8CrO_vPz5Gw.text: DON'T GO HERE! We got there at 10am with a party of 8. They said it would be an hour wait. Ok. We got coffee down the street and waited. After and hour and a half, we asked if they could split us up. They REFUSED to be accommodating in any way! We were getting pretty hungry. After TWO HOURS they still had not seated us! Seriously. We left hungry. I will NEVER EVER recommend this place to anyone or eat there myself. Who in their right mind waits TWO HOURS for food? Look at other reviews. Food takes 75 minutes to come? We were nuts.

fA-YeSCyYqqk-pOo600tQA.text: My boyfriend and I dined here for brunch this past Saturday around 1pm and had a very enjoyable experience. We called ahead and were told the wait was 45 minutes, but before we even arrived and parked- after 30 minutes- we were called and told our table was ready. We were seated as soon as we arrived at a corner table in the back. Waters were brought out immediately, much appreciated since it was a blazing hot day! Being it was hot- what did we both order? Hot coffee :) which was quite refreshing actually since we were in the cool back room. I went with the smoked salmon omelette with dill, chives, goat cheese, and tomatoes. I chose the potatoes over the toast. The omelette was amazing! The creaminess of the goat cheese paired perfectly with the smoky flavor of the salmon. I absolutely loved the addition of the dill and chives too. The potatoes were nothing special to write home about. The boy had the four cheese omelette- cheddar, Gouda, goat cheese, and American. He chose the rye toast with his. He said the  omelette was fluffy, cheesy goodness! Service was pretty good- I wish the coffee flowed a little more often than it did but when we could flag down the server we did get our refills. They have a ton of interesting sounding menu options - various other omlettes and Brie stuffed French toast in particular- that I'd love to go back and try in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Four cheese omelette
Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smoked salmon omelette with dill, chives, goat cheese

N77N2M40ZWjx4mdD-elWsg.text: I'm not sure if it was the hangover, or the fact that I hadn't eaten yet and it was 3 pm, but this meal was incredible. I had the banh mi and it was just so juicy and tasty and amazing. I devoured that, and had the goat cheese french toast, as well as some  raspberry (strawberry? I forget) pancakes, and took a bite of a sandwich while my friend wasn't looking (just kidding, I asked...or did I?!?).  All amazingly good. And super filling. Despite ready to eat a boar, I was so stuffed by the end of the meal that I didn't eat until very late in the evening. Really big fan. I wish this place existed where I live.

9MeN7RbrshEy7M97m58MUA.text: This place has been on my list since moving to Pittsburgh this summer. Met a friend who was in town from LA. Started with the turmeric chai latte with almond milk. So good and perfect for a winter day. I had the corned beef hash which came with potatoes, Brussels and cabbage. Was a great savory breakfast and I took half home for later. Would definitely come back again.

6zx0VtlaWjcPPiUgaXuLBA.text: Overall very impressed with Pittsburgh brunch!  The menu looks amazing Great selection of omelets.  The french toast my friend had was amazing.  Unfortunately my cassoulet wasn't what I really expected, but otherwise a great experience.  Check it out for yourself!  Notes from my visit:  Biscuits and sweet potato with jalapeno butter - pretty good  Carrot orange ginger juice - a bit heavy on the carrot, but if that's what you're looking for.  Cassoulet, sunny side up - I was hoping for more of this dish, but there were too many ingredients going on to really stand out as an overall dish.

refQq9aJI4zUmn9izACdrw.text: Waited almost an hour to find out that our group of 6 was behind our other group of 7 after repeatedly being told we were coming up soon. Asked to split into 2 at that point and were told we could not without restarting our place in line. Will not be coming back.

mOFUQHQyuYNuqxTKwDrOsQ.text: Definitely one of the best breakfast spots in the city. The food is absolutely amazing. The menu has an eclectic variety of choices with a spin on traditional breakfast items. The location is small; so, get there early! If there is a wait don't be discouraged, the food is worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggplant eggs Benedict | Corned beef, brussel sprout, and potato hash | Side grits

DNxAeJJtUjIpjV5M4q50MA.text: We ate brunch here with some friends a few weeks ago - I had forgotten to jot a quick review about the place, so here goes...  We really liked their food on the day we visited. I've read through some of the other less glowing reviews and wonder if it's just that their consistency might be an issue. On this visit, we had some amazing plates - I thoroughly enjoyed their breakfast quesadilla, and my wife enjoyed one of their specialty omelets. The food was served promptly and at the right temperature, usually one of my biggest gripes with eating breakfast in many restaurants. Our waitress was very friendly, and didn't miss a beat with our table's fairly complex ordering. The ambience was great - not too noisy, but upbeat enough to be interesting.  We'll be back to try the place a few times and 'finalize' our impression, but the first impression was a great one... and first impressions count a lot!

2B__4PwosnZEs8-LJV_nWQ.text: Five stars for food, four stars for how longgg it takes for the food to arrive.  My friends loved the eggs benedict (fried eggplant and basil hollandaise?  What a fun twist!)  My smoked salmon omelet with goat cheese was also good, although it could have used a bit more goat cheese.   I'd gladly go five stars except for the 35-40 minute wait between ordering our food and receiving it.  That's just a bit too long for me.

HyGXRJxc7fq31cVReOFIjg.text: This place is always a favorite stop when visiting Pittsburgh and the food never disappoints.   The menu has changed in the last few years, so some of my go-to orders that were on the lunch menu are no longer served. (Bring back the curried chicken salad!)   The brunch menu consists mostly of egg dishes, but the standouts for us were the BiBimBap & the Herbed French Toast.   Servers are always friendly, but often seem a little confused. You can definitely expect to wait a while for your drinks to be made, so don't expect a quick meal at Coca Cafe. So take the opportunity to order a drink, I'd recommend the Lavender Steamer, and relax before your food comes.

SdnQ3CPrVGBDuUJYegIC8Q.text: Extremely slow, snarky service and waaaay over salted food.   Lurking under that salt mine is good-tasting food, I could just tell, but I started fibrillation before I reached it!  Great quirky space and great fresh orange juice are the big pluses. Coffee is mediocre at best and even so, it shouldn't take a full half hour to bring it, no matter how busy they are.  I'll scope out another place next time I'm on Butler. Too bad!

6fPf_lLB712LSu5xPfgibA.text: I want to like this place but the service is so terrible, it ruins the experience. And I am honestly an easy customer. I keep it simple and don't need much. Anyways, food is decent (overpriced) but expect to wait a long time for any attention from the staff. I tried giving them the eye so many times I couldn't believe they didn't ask me what I needed. When I got my breakfast with potatoes, they of course do not ask if I need anything else once they serve the plate, they leave the second the drop the plate so I didn't even have a chance to ask for something. Yes, I am sure they are busy, but come on, never had this poor of service in a while. Anyways, when I got the potatoes I knew I couldn't ask for ketchup because I didn't want to wait an hour for it. So ya, I should stop going. They have a couple great menu items but my tips for you are eat before u leave and bring your own water and don't want more than one cup of coffee. And have 2.5 hrs to do this.   Ways for Coca to improve: -Provide water pitchers -Greet people when they walk in -Put ketchup/hot sauce and typical things asked for on the table since you won't get it to us within the hour of our plate being served -ask if we need anything at least once during the experience  Good luck!

7oKg_xFhN2zenVImE4C-Gw.text: It was hard to enjoy the food, that was actually really good, because it was so warm inside & the juice we ordered wasn't even cold. The table and floor was sticky as well which sucked some of the joy out of the experience. I'd give the food itself and the menu 4 or 5 stars, but there were a few other elements that bumped it down for me!

photos.caption: Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

KPbCtu4NPBSOd1Wedlq5Cw.text: My favorite breakfast spot! It's a tiny little place so I highly suggest trying it on a weekday or very early on a weekend (otherwise there will be a long wait). The food takes a while but it's because they're making it to order. My favorites are the eggplant Benedict and the Challah French toast. My husband loves the Bi Bim Bap.   Young kid note: They have high chairs but no changing table in the bathroom.

YA8I3f_tPRM0o-COiiMTYQ.text: We stopped here for breakfast while in Pittsburgh on a Sunday morning. Upon arriving, the cafe looked pretty busy, but we were able to be seated in an annex area of the restaurant.  The service was alright. It was clear that the people working here were kind and upbeat, but it didn't seem like they had enough staff to take the orders, make drinks, serve food, and watch the door. Our server was a nice guy, but he took 10 minutes to bring us coffee and waters and forgot to put in our order, so we ended up waiting longer than we'd expected for food.   The food itself was awesome. I loved the spinach and mushroom omelet I ordered. It was the perfect amount of greasy and healthyish breakfast food all on one plate! I also asked for jam and received the most wonderful apricot compote I've ever tasted. It was like pure heaven in a little jam dish.   I would go back to Coca Cafe and I would recommend it to others. My only concern is that if the restaurant is busy, be prepared to wait a while.

photos.caption: Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spinach and mushroom omelet.
Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Taco omelet.

T34Ppu8BFqzfhoiJ4rzPnA.text: I think several other reviewers said all that needs to be said on this place. TLDR: 5-star food, 1-star service (specifically around wait times and attention paid to customers).  I don't believe the bad service and wait times are due to poor servers, as they seemed to be always moving and working. But something was off for sure. Maybe they were understaffed, maybe there's a lack of equal work distribution... I don't know.  All I do know we arrived before 10 AM and didn't get out of there until after 12:30 PM. It wasn't event that busy by regular restaurant standards, bums in seats but no major waiting line. Took 30 minutes from when we were seated to event have someone take our drink/food orders. Took an hour and a half to get our food - how hard is it to make french toast?  I had the Challah bread french toast with Brie and fig preserves. It was pretty good. Not a 90 minute wait good, that's for sure. You get two slices of french toast cut into halves (4 pieces), the brie was almost non-existent and aside from some mixed berry garnish that was all you got. Every other dish at our table got home fries at the least, French toast... nada.  We went here because it seemed to be the only breakfast joint in Lawrenceville, but with the time we wasted here we could have gone to the Strip district, eaten and come back and still been waiting.  Nice spot but needs a lot of work in my personal opinion...  Eatcrest Out

photos.caption: Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Challah French toast

RbilkpV_H_WmqnpszTrWfA.text: Really great food for brunch. There was no AC in the building so it was really hot and there were flies swarming in the windows. The service was really slow and mediocre. If I ate here again I'd get it to go.

xJtMAs8ZrWJM11pQ1oHmTg.text: I had high hopes for Coca Cafe. The original reason I decided to dine here was because brunch is my favorite meal of the day, and their brunch menu looked fantastic. I saw they had shakshuka, which is one of my favorite foods, so I had to try it since I can't find it at any restaurants where I'm from. The shakshuka was indeed good, but that's about as far as the praise goes for this place.  Upon arriving, my boyfriend and I were given a 15 minute wait time and the girl took our phone number and said she would call when our table was ready. We went back to the car to wait considering it was pretty cold. We sat in the car for over 30 minutes without a call. Finally, we went back in and asked when our table would be ready. Low and behold, we were next. We were sat in the very back corner of the restaurant which seemed to be ignored by most workers.  We weren't waited on right away, but that gave us time to look over the menu. We both ordered an iced chai latte to drink. I consider myself an iced chai connoisseur, and let me tell you, this one was nasty. Not only was the taste just not that good, but minutes after starting to drink it, my boyfriend got the burps and an upset stomach... I'm not sure what kind of quality milk they use but it obviously didn't agree well with him.   Some time went by before a different waitress came to take our order. I, shakshuka, and my boyfriend, tofu scramble with avocado mash and potatoes. The food took a solid 30-45 minutes to come out, and the entire time we waited, we were not checked on once. Finally, a very nice man from the kitchen brought our food to us. He was the most attentive person we dealt with the entire morning, as he asked us if we needed anything else. He was clearly busy so we said no thank you and let him get back to his job.   The food was about the only good thing about this place. The shakshuka was as I expected, but my brother makes better. Still, it wasn't disappointing. My boyfriend's tofu scramble seemed alright but he couldn't even enjoy it because his stomach was hurting so bad. We asked a waitress for water and she said she'd bring the pitcher around but never came back. We waited another 15-20 minutes or so before my boyfriend went up to the counter to get our check so we could get the heck out of this place.  Overall, we invested about 2 hours of time and about $40 into this place, and it wasn't worth it at all. We had amazing food the rest of our trip, and this was our last meal before heading home. Pittsburgh is a city full of exciting eateries with high-quality chefs and superb wait staff, but Coca Cafe just didn't quite fit in.

photos.caption: Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The only good thing to come out of our visit to Coca Cafe-- the shakshuka.

TABoXagaj-prClCyOkJL9Q.text: Boy was it warm in there today! My husband and I had been before on the weekend with friends and it must not have been summer. We had to move to sit closer to a fan and debated leaving altogether due to the heat. It's a small cozy food spot with coffee and boozy options. When I asked about the cocktails (that are on their wall in chalk) I was told there was a pause, a sigh, and a "not right now- I can't". It was after 12 so it doubt it was a liquor licensing issue. I suppose it was an overwhelmed worker issue. I ordered the oats because I wasn't super hungry. They had lots of delicious options on the menu but it was so warm in there I couldn't imagine how much more uncomfortable I would be with a hot meal. My husband ordered the avocado omelet was and I had the oats. The oats were what you would expect them to be. It was fine and appropriately priced at 4 bucks with a bit of fruit on top. I wished they were a bit sweeter but they were a nice fresh, cool, and healthy option. His omelette was so delicious!! The omelette itself had so much delicious flavor. The salsa was fresh and balanced it perfectly. It came with the option of a salad or potatoes. Both were great. Our friend had he breakfast sandwich and it was filling and delicious according to him.  It's my second time here- food has been great both times and they have amazing options. It definitely keeps this place flooding. The service and atmosphere not so much. I had a little bit of an attitude from our server last time too and thought it might have been a one time thing. Might be the standard. Probably won't be back but if you're not easily offended and just want a fresh good meal then check it out!

pva4eJvtNcQXq0KZpfdPxg.text: Delightful food, but service can be hit or miss (in terms of speed). Everyone who works here is super pleasant, and the food is amazing, which is why I keep coming back. It feels like such a treat to get lunch and a drink here. I've particularly enjoyed the bibimbap and the lavender lemondade.

H3CiG0LApOsIvKmNNgDNhw.text: This is an easy going local cafe with a unique menu. It's special that you can rely on Coca to have breakfast foods for you all day, but they're not you're mom's breakfast foods.   The options here are a bit of a twist on your classic comforts -like kimchi and bacon on your breakfast sandwich or tumeric and nutritional yeast in your omelette. Having said that, you likely won't find these options in many other places around the city.  The cafe has a lived in, hipster kind of vibe, so expect the quirkiness that comes along with that. There are mismatched chairs and retro round tables spanning the cafe with small booth style seating area in the back. Large windows allow plenty of natural light to flood the cafe.   The service here is in no rush, so make sure you come feeling relaxed with plenty of time. The service won't be completely attentive, so if you need someone's attention, don't be afraid to go ask for it.  The sandwiches were actually twice the size I expected. It's great to get a sandwich with the sides, plus add another small plate option and split everything with someone. Or, it's easy to take the other half of your sandwich home.   There's a lot of free parallel parking on all the side streets, or metered parking on the main street in front of the cafe.

photos.caption: Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. A few other tables in the front room of the cafe.
Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Great window seating if you can snag a front table - but plenty of natural light in this whole cafe.
Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smoked Salmon Eggs Benedict

eYbyr9H0Fq8UcwFwo3Fp-Q.text: This place was probably the worst breakfast place I've ever been to. The iced vanilla latte was average. The Challah French toast had some weird stuff on it that made it taste like something my mom would make, and she can't cook. She might actually make a better French toast.  I would rather eat at McDonald's. The best thing there was probably the water. Even though the doughnuts hole things were a 3/10. Those two things have Coca Cafe the one star rating. My boyfriend and I payed 32 dollars for a crap meal.

IBFp1A2-94eyMsGXTyoWww.text: I was hesitant coming here because of the negative reviews but many of those are due to wait time. The food here is phenomenal and really tasty. You honestly cannot go wrong with any of the omelette options. Their drink assortment is tasty as well. I definitely recommend their earl grey and lavender latte. I also used yelp ahead of time to make a reservation so it expedited our waiting time. But the prior reviews are not wrong, the service is slow about 30 minutes after ordering will your food arrive. The prices are reasonable and the ambience is very cozy for a Saturday or Sunday brunch. It may be a little hard to find parking but there are plenty of side streets. I will definitely be back to try their other food items. Everything was really delicious!

Z_vNGV-KErifSGKuqwNMWA.text: If I was judging on food alone, this would be a 5-Star review. Unfortunately, the service here impairs the quality of the dining experience. Normally, I can look past this, but both times I dined at Coca Cafe, the wait time after being seated was excessive and the restaurant seemed perpetually understaffed. The 2nd time I dined there, I did not receive cutlery until a good 10 minutes after my food had arrived, and by the time I was able to start eating, my entree was cold.  Focusing on the food, I'd highly recommend the eggplant eggs Benedict and shakshuka to everyone out there. The eggplant eggs Benedict has perfectly crisp eggplant slices, which complements the Basil Hollandaise well. The poached eggs were just the right amount of runny. For the shakshuka, be prepared to have your taste buds tingle! Perfectly spiced and seasoned, especially when paired with the pita.

photos.caption: Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggplant eggs Benedict, shakshuka, and mushroom eggs Benedict
Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggplant Eggs Benedict with Potatoes

TVDQvmn2akibaXGD7kBuww.text: Terrible experience. An hour wait before drinks were served, dirty silverware, hair in multiple meals, and poor service. The waitress didn't even apologize for the uncleanliness of the cafe.   Would not recommend.

gSkJobdwjZU3ifewiOgC1Q.text: I am unimpressed by this place. I have been there five times and only two times I actually got to eat.  Two of the times, I made plans with friends to eat there for breakfast. After double checking their hours on their website, we arrived 15-30 minutes after "opening" and the lights were off, the door was locked and no one was inside. There was no sign communicating a change in hours or emergency that required them not to open.  A different time, I planned to meet a friend at 8:30am (30 minutes after their website says they open). When I arrived the door was still locked but a woman was inside. When she unlocked the door to let us in, she made no attempt to apologize for opening late or forgetting to unlock the door. I did get to eat there this time (my first experience doing so). However, the woman was sweeping the shop while we were there. When she brought our food, she did not wash her hands between sweeping and serving our food. Gross!  One of the other experiences I had there was when I showed up on a Sunday to have brunch and there were no open tables. We were told the wait was 45minutes +, but there was nowhere to stand. It's a very odd set up because when you enter the restaurant you are immediately in the dining area, no vestibule, no real hostess/host stand. Naturally, it's very uncomfortable (and I'm not sure even allowed) to stand and wait. So we just went elsewhere.  The only time I showed up and ate with minimal issues, the food was great! However, I've had enough of this place and their lack of consistency. Change your hours on your website if you aren't going to be open! Seems like a poor business model.  If you are looking for a spot nearby that will be open and serves wonderful food might I suggest Caffe Mona.

photos.caption: Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

HYfSD5SyMsxs6ONELbev3w.text: Always enjoy a great breakfast here, this day was no different. I sat outside in their side patio on a quiet Friday morning. Service was quick, friendly, and intuitive to when i needed my check.  I got the eggplant Benedict with a generous side of cheesy grits. It was wonderful. Good coffee, too!

photos.caption: Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggplant Benedict with side of cheesy grits
Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Quiet patio

QnpEd-bDJ1ljOwG4Z4q87A.text: Sunday brunch.. I'm going to type this slow because I was so upset that I don't want to miss anything. So my date and I was in to put our name on the list, did so and was told about "30 minutes", also that the espresso machine was down so we could go down the street, grab a coffee and they would text us, so we put out names on the yelp waiting list, which is a great addition to this app btw, and went to grab a coffee.... that coffee at espresso Mano was the best thing we had all day. The 30 minute wait turned into 48 minutes, which in itself would not be bad, but that wasn't all of it! Once we sat down, we ordered our Bloody Mary and our meal.... 30 minutes later the Bloody Mary came.. it was awful, no ice and thick like tomato soup and almost no vodka in it. The food showed up 1 hour and 35 minutes later.. I kid you not!! It was ridiculous  They claimed they didn't expect it to be busy, with this kind of service, they won't have to worry, it won't be that busy in the future if they keep that up.

FYhDWjUnviN98mwpasc8Wg.text: I was wondering why is the rate going down since I last come. Now I know why! I had probably the worst bimbimbap in my life. It took them about half hour to make it and it came out cold( it was suppose to be hot) and the rice was so hard that tasted like leftover from longtime ago. The egg was over cooked and hard to break. It just looked like a leftover plate not something freshly made at all. I am so disappointed see this place going downhill. It use to be one of my favorite breakfast spot. Probably not going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggplant benedit
Photo of Coca Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

7fl-MxsEOjNJzxGh-SCYKQ.text: We recently ate a late breakfast here and both thought it was one of the best breakfasts we have ever had in Pittsburgh. In fact, we found ourselves comparing it to great breakfast experiences we have had in Puerto Rico and Seattle. The place's interior is cute to begin with; and the menu is so much more interesting than the average restaurant. Most important, they pulled off the unusual touches. It was hard to choose between the creative omelette choices, and the waitress was really helpful with this. I selected the roasted vegetable omelette and it was excellent, both the roasted veggies and the spices. My partner had the breakfast sandwich with eggs and sausage and was equally pleased. Even the bread - which I learned was from Allegro Bakery in Squirrel Hill - was much better than what is typically offered with breakfasts. We are looking forward to a second visit there and are particularly hoping to get there for Sunday brunch!

pQMcSWqCdSEdWUrGeyKAdA.text: Went for breakfast on an early Wednesday morning.  I was the first one there a few minutes after 7 am.  Super friendly and prompt service.  Comfortable and funky decor that I really liked.  Excellent coffee, and they brewed fresh decaf for me on request after 2 cups of regular.  I had the avocado omelet, which was pretty good, but I think they forgot the jalepeno cheese in it.  $10.50 tab, before tip.  I would probably go back again -- but would check out some other places in the neighborhood first.  Seems like a friendly and funky place.

nnQS8tgY01XspSyHn6n71Q.text: There is a good reason that you never get a line out the door at most places.  Coca Cafe has earned that line out the door and the wait is VERY well worth it.  If you enjoy dishes prepared with care each and every time, then you will very much enjoy this gem.

SsQDvt7pp3HtLstP-mgwxA.text: Such a good breakfast!  My mouth is watering at the thought of it.  I had the herbed goat cheese stuffed French toast.  The meal with delicious.  The mix of the flavors of the goat cheese with the maple syrup and the contrast between cheese and French toast was to die for.  My friends ordered the apple cinnamon panini and the almond French toast, and both thought they were delicious.  The atmosphere at Coca Cafe was fun, with bright colors, high ceilings, and comfortable seats.  The service was good, prompt, and polite.  I noticed that the wall menu has fresh juices and smoothies, so I hope to go back sometime to try those; I don't live in Pittsburgh, but I'll be stopping by this place every time I'm back.

I__Xbo3eRB8qYxLC5R-65w.text: I always enjoy coca.  great food and cool atmosphere.  I had a sandwich there that was prob one of the best i've ever had...pears, brie, arugula, turkey.   really good.  cool employees too.

SjAk6IO42QLBKaOTNoAzow.text: I love this place and eat here quite frequently. That being said I know they get very busy on Sunday brunch. Knowing this I always call ahead for a table. This week I was incredibly disappointed. I called ahead at 12:07 and was old a table would be ready in 45 minutes. We got there a few minutes early so that we would be there when they called. Upon getting there I told the waitress that we were there and would be outside, at this time she said it would probably be about 20 more minutes! Ok so we took a walk, came back, waited some more. Needless to say I called at 12:07, was told 45 minutes and did not get seated until 1:38. An hour and a half later!!! I watched countless tables that were below my name on the list get called. I'm a little flustered, starving, and now all my other plans for the day are ruined. By the time we. Were seated half the items on the special menu were sold out. I'm very frustrated. While th food may be good I definitely have experienced better service.

vg7RxYKboiSyBRTLeL78vg.text: Ohhhh mama.  Came here right before Thanksgiving, so one of their specials was the Thanksgiving Breakfast - Turkey sausage with yukon potato hash smothered in mushroom gravy with bread pudding and a side of cranberry sauce.  Wasn't sure what made this a "breakfast" dish other than the hash, so I went ahead and asked for a fried egg on top.  I have to admit, when the dish came out, I was a little taken aback by the grey color of the mushroom gravy, but don't let it fool you.  It's was super delicious and wish they could have this dish all year long.

ZXOxl4oyBa4JTN3hPbnYyw.text: My favorite brunch in the city.   Herbed goat cheese French toast is the best.   6 stars.

3gjYSjw69PoyoGQeaoarDw.text: Love this place. The food is simple but amazing and not pricey. Great for lunch!

HbejFuj3HjY-HrA9ikmf7Q.text: Things like freshly squeezed juices and French toast stuffed with figs and goat cheese for under $10 make this the best breakfast and brunch in Lawrenceville. If you show up at 10am, there is no wait on the weekends. Otherwise expect to wait 30 minutes or more.

HWyKteX9dVkMWiNRlJLXGg.text: Cinnamon Apple Panini's for brunch.  Sign me up.  Yum doesn't even begin to describe the Sunday brunch at Coca Cafe.

JHXpToOwlnTAQM3FDmihPg.text: So...I have never made it in here for their famous brunch, because it always looks so darn crowded, with a super long wait!  Regardless, I have had their food at any number of events, and it never ceases to amaze!  In addition to eating in at their charming location, talk to them about catering if you want your event to be really remembered.  A high number of vegan and vegetarian options, in addition to those with meat.  These gals are truly accommodating.

j4Qi0cteXa2Xlw3QuqmTPw.text: A great place to eat love everything about it!!!! try the Salmon omelet with the goat cheese OMG!!!!!

Yw9Qrxkv0jqXxLOBGhwSyA.text: I've only been here once for brunch, but I quite enjoyed the experience. It gets busy, so be prepared to wait.

U5wyckP5MkunnoKfi20O1g.text: I went here for brunch on a Saturday with my friend since she said she's heard good things about this place.  This place is next door to Piccolo Forno.  When we got there, the place was packed and there were people waiting to be seated outside.  We came inside and put our names down for a table.  The place is quite big.  There are dining areas in the front and back rooms as well as a few outdoor tables hidden in the back where it's nice and quiet.  We sat outside underneath the shade.  I ordered almond french toasts, which were slices of baguette bread (sliced on the bias), prepared french toast style with thin slices of almond on top and drizzled with lemon butter.  The toasts were crunchy (but not dry or hard) at the crust and golden toasty but soft and dense inside, which is just the way I like them.  No soggyness. The lemon butter complimented the cinnamon and almond flavors of the toasts quite well. While we were eating, it started to drizzle but because we were sitting under the trees, we didn't get wet at all and didn't have to move.  It was interesting to eat outside while it was raining.  Overall, even though I'd only been there once I enjoyed the entire experience.  Service was good.

153qzVKlp8lTsMAwXdVWYA.text: I finally made it here for Sunday Brunch and definitely will be back.  It's deservedly a popular place, so be prepared to wait if you get there during peak hours.  However, they take your cell phone number and call when your table is ready, so you can walk around the neighborhood and check out the cute shops while you wait.    The service was prompt and friendly, and the food was delicious.  I had the egg white omelet - I am a sucker for anything with goat cheese.  Had a hard time choosing because everything on the menu sounds great.  My friend had the breakfast sandwich...the bread looked amazing.  They were both served with potatoes...yum.  We loved our food and look forward to trying more of the menu.

cpHcbdAD5UaGlQioPMR6Ag.text: This is a great little restaurant that gets very crowded. I had an excellent mother-daughter brunch here, and we thoroughly enjoyed the food. I found the servings to be very large and delicious, especially the 4-cheese omelet. There was decent service for the crowd and the food and coffee weren't sacrificed. I'm looking forward to another delicious breakfast here.  It's a little more expensive than my typical breakfast choice but given the food quality and quantity, the price is more than reasonable. As a tip, I arrived promptly on a Saturday morning (9am is when they open), and there were plenty of tables open.

0_DVP1IgRxfJ-0RQcTLGJw.text: We had the most wonderfully tasty brunch here.  My friend and I split two of the brunch options- the french toast with lemon cream and almond sauce on top (which was out of this world) and the egg sandwich with veggie sausage (which was also really good).  It ended up being way too much food but it was so freaking good.  I am not sure what they do to their eggs but they tasted far better than any eggs I have ever had anywhere else.  The french toast was killer.  I see why this place often has lines waiting- phenomenal brunch.

pyK1bGQSh3Hu40ljp5yIwg.text: Great food! Brunch is good every time, and their chairs are ohhhh sooo comfortable. I recommend any of their french toasts.  Everyone else is right, though -- the wait is excruciatingly long. Their tables are all odd sizes, which means they often seat parties of 6 before parties of 2, or parties of 2 at massive tables... etc. Not bad when the weather is nice and you don't mind standing on the street, but awful when it's winter.  Also: their standard coffees and teas are quite good, but their "specialty" espresso beverages are awful. Too sugary, burnt-tasting... yuck.

0ftL6eGaffHpa97uIfeTeg.text: This is a great place for Brunch on a weekend.  The place is small, so there is often a wait.  It is not very handicap friendly (as far as I could tell, maybe there was an area that was but some f the tables were on ledged platforms etc that would make wheelchair access difficult).  The food here is excellent.  While there are other places in town that have lovely pancakes, omelets etc., this is the first place that I have seen that sees fit to innovate a bit with their menu.  They have a savory french toast which is stuffed with an herbed goat cheese that is absolutely delicious and a really pleasant surprise.

jXjCU9E-Ij-6_s6dOGVVBA.text: went there today. best white omlet in years, clean bright place with street parking. Just a bit slow but very friendly

hbeyM5Kqpd5SOGOBOZ1lKQ.text: Food is tasty, and I definitely like taking friends to get the delicious stuffed french toast and such here. Unfortunately the service can be seriously lacking in-part due to the fullness of the place for brunch, and in part due to less than attentive waitstaff. My major issue here is that the place could be a LOT cleaner. As someone who has worked in foodservice for a long time, that was one of the first things I noticed, and I wonder about (but try not to think on too long) the conditions in the kitchen as a result. If the place was a little more kept-up I'd definitely give it higher marks.

QBPiJPEOUCnncI-_QNO2xg.text: It's my first time here, but it won't be my last. Goat cheese french toast is awesome and my waitress was amazing.

oggMNVQRagWhx7vqo8jMBg.text: The long, long, long wait is the only drawback to Coca Cafe. If you have a lot of time to wait and then sit and have some really amazing food, it is worth it. The atmosphere is Europe meets SoHo, and it gives a retro vibe. There is local art covering the walls and great window lighting.  Sunday brunch is their specialty, and that is when you will wait at least an hour. You can always go grab a coffee at Espresso A  Mano and visit the great Lower Lawrenceville shops. All of the items on the brunch menu are unique, but well thought-out, and delicious. You can tell everything is extremely fresh. They even have fresh squeezed juices and smoothies. My personal favorite dish is the Southwestern Breakfast Wrap made with tofu and a side of guacamole. The daily breakfast and lunch menus are equally as inventive, offering pancakes and french toast, pastries, eggs, sandwiches and wraps, and salads. They cater to vegetarians and vegans, which is always refreshing. The lunch barbecued tofu salad is very good, atop fresh mixed greens. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and they manage to remain calm even when it seems the whole city is at their door. I would recommend this place to anyone who is visiting the city, artistic, vegetarian, or just if they are really into Sunday brunch!

AiGSB4IDbCZQiH7zDHRsSA.text: Love love love this place!  I've tried multiple breakfast and lunch dishes and they haven't let me down.  Not to mention that it's extremely difficult to find restaurants that will cater to someone with a gluten allergy properly in this city.

7Ts9O8QxZeMulpLr_ISmsA.text: This is where I discovered that avocado does not belong in an omelette. But the smoked salmon omelette is fantastic.

T8W06P57G8Ljv5lxAZ1JQA.text: We arrived here at 12:15 pm on a Saturday with the hopes of getting brunch and we were told that it would be a 45 mins wait. Basically, they took our phone number and told us to go wait somewhere else. While at this time we were still waiting for the third person in our party to arrive this was kind of OK but it was freezing outside and we didn't know where to go to wait. It took us 15 minutes to walk back to our car, decide to go somewhere else and just as I was about to call Coca to cancel our walk-in reservation, they called us to say they had a table ready. Now because of the initial information of us probably waiting for 45 minutes, there has been some internal confusion and inconvenience in our little group of 3 because it was a "no" at first and then it became a "yes".  We came back to Coca, still waiting for our third member and were seated. In like five minutes we were asked if our friend was on his way. We said yes but the experience itself already became really frustrating and stressful as our friend had just left his place and decided that he wasn't in the mood for food but was gonna still join us for coffee. Was it OK for Coca that he would just have coffee? Were we being inappropriate blocking a 4 person table with 3 people eating and 1 just having coffee? Cut the long story short, although the food was really good, our experience here has been really stressful for me. I like places where I can show up and eat without an expected wait time of 45 minutes and I'm not rushed to leave the place immediately. It's brunch after all, it's supposed to be chill...

QeIdT4Gi_3qgzsrzX0oXZQ.text: I've been here for breakfast several times-- the menu is varied and my meal has always been tasty. Service is good enough. I would like to try their lunch sometime.

eMktj3pwvHclXQE30q_zQw.text: Apparently for a place that closes at 2pm, arriving at 12:30pm and being told they aren't taking diners is a bit backwards, especially when you see people getting ready to leave.

17ulsXUWBFL-TEwZeLV0-A.text: Slow service is something I can endure, but lying to customers with no apology is just too much.   We expected about the slow service like others had mentioned since we have been there many times.   The waitress took our orders and we started to wait. After 30-40 minutes, a waiter came to asked us again what we ordered. We saw the waitress started to bring food to tables came after us. We knew then they probably messed up our orders.   Then around an hour passed, other tables came after us started to finish their meals. We asked the waitress and she said there were two big tables in front of us so tables came later have to wait. Just then, they brought food to another table came after us!   Another waitress came and said, "Those guests have been there the WHOLE time and you came in after them." I was really disappointed that the waitress just lied to my face. We watched them came in while we were waiting.   "This is the part of the experience!" That waitress added. Whether she meant the slow service part or the lying part, I don't know.   I also don't know why apologizing would be so hard for them. From start to finish, not a single sorry. I am sad that this was one of our favorite brunch spots. But if this lying to customers' faces is part of the experience, I don't think I will go back there again.
